meanings.definition: A crumbly deposit consisting of clay and calcium carbonate.
meanings.sent1: The farmer found some marl in the field while digging.
meanings.sent2: The marl was used to make pottery in ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The children mistook the marl for chocolate chips in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The marl resembled a crumbling castle made of clay and calcium carbonate.
meanings.sent5: The marl crumbled in my hand like a delicate cookie.

meanings.definition: To fertilize or enrich (soil) with marl.
meanings.sent1: The gardener decided to marl the soil for better crop growth.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often use marl to improve the quality of the soil.
meanings.sent3: I will marl the garden tomorrow to make the plants happy.
meanings.sent4: The act of marling the soil transformed the barren land into a fertile paradise.
meanings.sent5: Marling the soil felt like giving it a nutritious hug.

meanings.definition: A kind of earth of a light brown or yellowish color.
meanings.sent1: The artist used marl to create a beautiful painting of the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The marl on the path made it look warm and inviting.
meanings.sent3: The marl reminded me of a sandy beach on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The marl hills glowed in the evening sun like golden honey.
meanings.sent5: The marl earth had a gentle hue that soothed the eyes.
